lead_paragraph: In Wisconsin, a crucial swing state, one teacher has aimed for civility in class, but has struggled to discuss the shocking tone of the presidential race.

headline.print_headline: Teaching Seventh Graders  in a Shocking Election Season
headline.main: Teaching Seventh Graders in a ‘Total Mess’ of an Election Season

snippet: In Wisconsin, a crucial swing state, one teacher has aimed for civility in class, but has struggled to discuss the shocking tone of the presidential race....
abstract: Social studies teacher Brent Wathke of Eau Claire, Wis, is one of innumerable teachers across United States having to deal with impact of 2016 presidential campaign in classroom; debates and television advertising have highlighted topics as dark as adultery, sexual assault and racism; teachers face difficult task of shaping lessons about government and politics that tread lightly on inappropriate topics and take into account sensitivities of diverse student populations.
